Hi Justin Olsen, ​The issue of connecting and then disconnecting is usually caused by insufficient USB power. Please avoid using a USB hub — instead, connect the device directly to a USB 3.0 port on the back of your PC. This will ensure stable power supply and should resolve the problem.

Its plugged directly into the pc. This is very frustrating because I was
exited for the product but its not working like I'd hoped.

Hi Justin Olsen,  You purchased an HB Pro handbrake. Could you please clarify — does it disconnect immediately after plugging into USB, or does it disconnect after being connected for a while?  Once you're back home, I can assist you remotely to quickly identify and resolve the issue. Rest assured, we provide full after-sales support to ensure your device works as expected.  您购买的

After a while. Yeah it just disconnects randomly. But frequently. Also im
home now yes

On Wed, Jul 16, 2025, 12:35 AM service@simsonn.com

Anyway I could get a replacement or a refund so I can re order?

On Wed, Jul 16, 2025, 12:37 AM Justin Olsen <justin.olsen122@gmail.com>

> On Wed, Jul 16, 2025, 12:35 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Justin Olsen,  It's also possible that the Type-C connector on the handbrake is loose. Please try gently touching the Type-C connection to see if it causes the device to disconnect, which may indicate a loose or unstable connection.  Additionally, please take a photo showing the Type-C cable plugged into your computer so we can verify if everything looks properly connected.  To check if the USB disconnection issue is caused by insufficient power supply, you can try setting the LED brightness to 0% in SIMSONN Manager 2.0.8 to turn off the lighting effects. Then observe whether the disconnection issue still occurs.

Let me try all that. I don't think any of that is the case. Im pretty
technically savy and I think its more likely internal. But happy to
troubleshoot.

Hi Justin Olsen,    So far, we haven’t received similar reports from other customers about frequent disconnection issues with the HB Pro.  To help us investigate further, could you please provide a photo of the Type-C port on the back of your PC? This will help us verify whether you’re using a USB 3.0 port and assess if the power supply is stable.  In most cases, such issues are related to unstable USB power from the computer rather than a problem with the device itself. If it were a hardware issue, we would likely be receiving the same feedback from other users — but so far, we haven't.

It is indeed plugged into a 3.0 port its hard to take a photo because of
how the pc is placed.  Any other ideas?

On Wed, Jul 16, 2025, 12:55 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Justin Olsen,  If the disconnection only happens while you're playing games, it's likely caused by frequent movement when pulling the handbrake, which may lead to a loose USB connection. We recommend using a zip tie to secure the USB cable, ensuring a stable and tight connection before testing again. Otherwise, even if we send you a replacement, the issue could persist if the USB connection becomes loose again due to constant movement of the rig.

This is very frustrating. I feel like a product this expensive shouldn't be
having these issues. I'll see if I can try to see if it works. Is there
anything you can do to compensate me? For the trouble

On Thu, Jul 17, 2025, 5:50 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Justin Olsen,     There are typically only a few reasons for USB disconnection issues:    Using a USB hub, which can cause unstable connections;    Not plugging the device into a USB 3.0 port on the back of your PC case;    A loose or frequently wobbled USB connection;    If you're using a Fanatec or Moza base, lack of proper grounding to your PC case can also cause USB dropouts due to EMI.    We recommend turning off your wheelbase and leaving it off for an hour to observe whether the USB disconnection still occurs. Meanwhile, check SIMSONN Manager to see if your device is still sending output signals—this can help determine whether the issue is hardware-related. The HB Pro hardware is highly reliable and very unlikely to fail under normal conditions.      Here are the recommended solutions for interference mitigation:  1. Ensure your PC is properly grounded to a reliable household ground. Some wall outlets have only two wires and no ground line. This not only poses a safety risk but also prevents electromagnetic interference from devices like Fanatec from being properly discharged.  2. Use a wire to connect the metal housing of the rig or base to the PC case. This helps establish a shielding path and improves overall interference resistance.     3.    Avoid high-interference zones: Keep USB cables away from high-voltage power lines or adapters; route cables separately where possible.  ​   4. Use a USB isolator: If the above methods don’t resolve the issue, using a USB isolator is recommended. It physically separates the USB power and data lines, effectively shielding the control device from EMI sources.  ​   https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting  ​   https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding  ​   Additionally, our device is CE EMI certified and does not emit electromagnetic interference to external equipment.

I will try all that.
